bibl.title: The Roman Coinage of Alexandria, 30 B.C.-A.D. 296: Interplay between Roman and Local Designs.
bibl.note: "Clearly, the mint of Alexandria behaved in a very different way from a normal provincial mint, and for most of its existence it acted like a branch of the Rome mint."

bibl.title: Archaeological Research in Roman Egypt. The Proceedings of The Seventeenth Classical Colloquium of The Department of Greek and Roman Antiquities, British Museum, held on 1-4 December, 1993

bibl.seg: BLAND Roger, The Roman Coinage of Alexandria, 30 B.C.-A.D. 296: Interplay between Roman and Local Designs.

Archaeological Research in Roman Egypt. The Proceedings of The Seventeenth Classical Colloquium of The Department of Greek and Roman Antiquities, British Museum, held on 1-4 December, 1993 = JRA. Supplementary Series. 19 (Ann Arbor, Michigan, 1996) pp. 113-127, 63 figg. sur 3 pll., 6 graphiques.
"Clearly, the mint of Alexandria behaved in a very different way from a normal provincial mint, and for most of its existence it acted like a branch of the Rome mint."
